election_record.label: Rhode Island 1803 Governor

overview.note: The Federalists did not compete for any of the State Offices in 1803 and as the Republican Ticket was unopposed, the returns were not reported in the newpapers.

"Governor - Lieutenant Governor - all the Senators - and fifty out of seventy Representative, are Republicans. - In the whole General House of Representatives, in Grand Committee, consisting of 82, the Federalists amount only to 20." Herald of the United States (Warren, RI). April 21, 1803.

sub_unit.name: Warren
sub_unit.note: "Seventy three proxies were given in for the first officers in this state, for the year ensuing, agreeably to the one published in the Herald of the 7th and 14th instant." Herald of the United States (Warren, RI). April 21, 1803.

election_record.reference: Herald of the United States (Warren, RI). April 21, 1803.
